qas.question: Who was the Prime Minister of the British Government in 1853?
Who did Aberdeen appoint the position of British ambassador to the Ottoman Empire to?
Who replaced Stratford Canning after he first resigned as British ambassador to the Ottoman Empire ?
After resigning where did Stratford Canning sail off to?
Who did Stratford Canning convince to turn down the treaty proposal?

context: In February 1853, the British government of <a0_0>Lord Aberdeen<a0_0/>, the prime minister, re-appointed <a1_0>Stratford Canning<a1_0/> as British ambassador to the Ottoman Empire.:110 Having resigned the ambassadorship in January, he had been replaced by <a2_0>Colonel Rose<a2_0/> as chargé d'affaires. Lord Stratford then turned around and sailed back to <a3_0>Constantinople<a3_0/>, arriving there on 5 April 1853. There he convinced the <a4_0>Sultan<a4_0/> to reject the Russian treaty proposal, as compromising the independence of the Turks. The Leader of the Opposition in the British House of Commons, Benjamin Disraeli, blamed Aberdeen and Stratford's actions for making war inevitable, thus starting the process which would eventually force the Aberdeen government to resign in January 1855, over the war.
